MR No. 1555 - Perplexities in the South Are Not Impossibilities; Work on in Faith

     (Written August 14, 1898, from Sunnyside, Cooranbong, to Edson and Emma White.) 


     I have a few words to say to you. You must not be discouraged. I know how hard you are striving to push the work forward, but as long as you have that portion of the field to work perplexities will arise, and your only relief will be to take these matters to the Lord in prayer. Do not dwell in silence; speak to the Lord and He will say, here I am, what will you that I shall do?
